page.title: 06EARNSLOW GRANGE,WHITEGATE
page.content: In the dairy the electricity bill is approximately Â£800 a year. The milk is collected at about 9.00 a.m. each morning. It is taken to a dairy in Manchester. The farmer is paid fourteen and a half pence per litre for the milk. When all the milk has been taken from the cow, the feeder is automatically turned off. All cows produce a different amount of milk, all the cows here are Friesians. In winter the cows are fed on soya and beans for their protein. They are given water to drink, silage (pickled grass), hay and some iron concentrates. The owner has just his brother to help him but manages to run the farm successfully.He plans to make the farm run as efficiently as possible.
